<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/17/gamestop-saga-key-players-set-appear-congressional-committee?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's GameStarting Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/17/gamestop-saga-key-players-set-appear-congressional-committee" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Gavel with GameStop written on it " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDgzL2dhdmVsX3N0b3AuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember in January when every other word uttered in English was "GameStop"? Get ready for another round at noon today, when the main characters of the saga will have their buns sufficiently warmed by the House Committee on Financial Services. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong></span><span>GameStop was </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/25/gamestop-powered-amateur-investors-continues-defy-reality?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>the </em>story</a></span><span> a few weeks ago after a legion of fanatical retail investors mobilized on Reddit to launch a short squeeze that sent GameStop shares rocketing higher and forced hedge funds to seek emergency bailouts. The stock has since succumbed to gravity, trading at around $45 a share, down from $483 at its peak. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, lawmakers will <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/robinhood-reddit-ceos-to-testify-in-congress-on-gamestop-gme-5112714?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ask questions of</a> the alleged rabble-rousers. Among them, Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev, Reddit CEO Steve Huffman, Citadel CEO Ken Griffin, Melvin Capital founder Gabe Plotkin, and the now-infamous trader Keith “Roaring Kitty” Gill.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What can you expect?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a statement, committee head Rep. Maxine Waters said the hearing will take aim at the hedge fund industry’s “long history of predatory conduct,” as well as unpack Robinhood’s decision to halt trading of GameStop and other meme stocks when interest from individual traders was at its peak. One more phrase to watch on your hearing bingo card: payment for order flow (PFOF). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">PFOF</strong></span><span> involves </span><span><a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/paymentoforderflow.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rerouting trades</a></span><span> carried out on one platform to a third party to execute for a small fee. Robinhood makes the majority of its revenue this way, and some critics argue that’s not in the best interest of its customers. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even the cult hero Roaring Kitty is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/17/roaring-kitty-keith-gill-defends-gamestop-posts-says-he-is-as-as-bullish-as-ever-on-the-stock.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">under scrutiny</a> for his social media posts that helped spark retail interest in GameStop. Though the 34-year-old former MassMutual advisor maintains his posts were meant to be educational only, he hasn’t backed away from his commitment to GameStop. “I’m as bullish as I’ve ever been,” he said in a statement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The chances of specific regulations resulting from this far-ranging hearing are slim. But the committee stands ready to peel back the layers of a system they feel is set up to hurt the amateur investor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more on the hearing: </strong>We wrote <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/get-know-gamestop-hearings-five-key-witnesses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everything you need to know</a> about the 5 guys you'll hear from later today.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/17/rush-limbaugh-mark-left-us-media?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Right-Wing Radio Host Rush Limbaugh Dies at 70
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Conservative radio host Rush Limbaugh " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDgwL3J1c2hfbGltYmF1Z2guanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nicholas Kamm/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Kathryn Rogers, wife of talk radio personality Rush Limbaugh, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/conservative-radio-personality-rush-limbaugh-has-died-age-70-n1164306?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> on Limbaugh’s radio show that he had died of complications from lung cancer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We didn’t know Limbaugh personally, but we’d guess he preferred his right foot over his left. He rose to prominence during the presidency of Republican Ronald Reagan, whom he adored, and he detested former President Barack Obama, a Democrat. Limbaugh supported former President Trump throughout his presidency, and Trump honored him with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the US’ highest civilian honor. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Limbaugh was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/17/business/media/rush-limbaugh-dead.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">often criticized</a> for making sexist, homophobic, and racist comments, as well as for spreading falsehoods about Obama’s Affordable Care Act and Covid-19. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Limbaugh pioneered a highly successful genre of lowbrow outrage radio, beginning during the Republican revolution of Reagan’s time in office and lasting through the Trump years. Limbaugh earned $85 million/year and his show was the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/rush-limbaugh-right-wing-media-impresario-is-dead-at-70-11613583970?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most-listened-to</a> US radio talk show in 2020, with more than 20 million monthly listeners. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/17/happened-texas-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Texas’s Nightmare Week: What Went Wrong?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Texas’s energy crisis that began last weekend continued to drag through Wednesday. As of last night, 2.7 million homes in the state were still without power in frigid temperatures. Businesses from semiconductor makers to retailers have paused operations. How could something like this <a href="https://www.texasmonthly.com/news/what-went-wrong-with-texass-main-electric-grid-and-could-it-have-been-prevented/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">happen</a>?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The answer is unsatisfying:</strong> We don’t 100% know yet. Experts need to analyze what exactly went wrong with Texas’s power grid when the storm hit, but we know a few factors contributed to the widespread shutoffs: </p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The sheer scale of the storm. All 254 of Texas’s counties were under a winter storm warning at the same time. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It takes more energy to keep homes warm when it’s cold than it does to keep them cool when it’s hot—and Texas’s energy system is geared toward A/C.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Texas had not taken "</span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/02/16/ercot-texas-electric-grid-failure/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">winterization measures</a></span><span>" to protect its electric grid from freezing weather.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There’s a lot more competition for limited supplies of natural gas in the winter. </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The outages have led to criticism of Texas’s energy grid, which <a href="https://www.texastribune.org/2011/02/08/texplainer-why-does-texas-have-its-own-power-grid/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is (mostly) independent</a> from the rest of the US. If it were connected to other states, they could conceivably lend Texas their extra power. </p>

Key Performance Indicators

</h1>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy / NowThis</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re trying out a new segment called “Key Performance Indicators” with 1 quote, 1 stat, and 1 read, a format pioneered by our younger sibling, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=inline&utm_campaign=link&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Emerging Tech Brew</a>. Let us know what you think!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You had Madonna and Sean Penn walking in, Barbra Streisand and Don Johnson, Muhammad Ali would be there, Oprah sitting with Donald ringside...It was a special time. I’m sorry to see it go.”—Bernie Dillion, who decades ago was the events manager for the former Trump Plaza casino in Atlantic City, shared some memories with the AP as the building was <a href="https://apnews.com/article/trump-plaza-casino-imploded-cfd6efef1e4d23dfce977ab88e48e9de?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">demolished</a> yesterday. See above.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>As of last week, the CDC recorded 165 flu-related hospitalizations since October. During the 2019–2020 flu season, about 400,000 people were hospitalized with the flu and 22,000 people died. “Flu has been essentially nonexistent,” infectious disease expert Dr. William Schaffner <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/02/14/967431377/where-did-the-flu-go-homebound-kids-shape-a-mild-season?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told NPR</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Tech analyst Ben Thompson gives a <a href="https://stratechery.com/2021/clubhouses-inevitability/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predictably smart take</a> on Clubhouse.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEMOGRAPHICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/17/usps-data-shows-sf-exodusto-bay-area-counties?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
People Are Leaving San Francisco
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="the Golden Gate Bridge" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDc5L2dvbGRlbl9nYXRlX2JyaWRnZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But they're not ending up where you might think. US Postal Service data shows that San Fran residents <a href="https://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/article/People-are-leaving-S-F-but-not-for-Austin-or-15955527.php?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=headlines&utm_campaign=sfc_morningfix&sid=5fda689dea4aed7a287042e1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are indeed leaving</a> the city in droves—for other Bay Area counties including Alameda, San Mateo, and Marin.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Much hay has been made of a supposed mass migration away from ultra-expensive San Francisco, where the coronavirus knocked out perks like nightlife, restaurants, and amusement park-like corporate campuses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the new data challenges the idea that business-friendly, high-quality-of-life spots such as Denver and Austin are getting all the ex-San Franciscans. Those two cities were in the top 20 post-SF locations, but waaay behind places just a quick drive from the Embarcadero, like Sonoma County. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> One economist told the SF Chronicle the data could suggest a “silver lining” for the city’s recovery; it may be easier to lure residents back from Marin than Miami. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">

PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew Podcast Recommendation: 'Land of the Giants'
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="GIF of Joey from Friends saying, "You have got to listen" " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=559 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YSxABIzfohDMAelq41/giphy.gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='GIF of Joey from Friends saying, "You have got to listen" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YSxABIzfohDMAelq41/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tuesday, our pals in business writing at Recode dropped the <a href="https://www.vox.com/land-of-the-giants-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first episode</a> in the newest season of <em>Land of the Giants</em>, their podcast series about Silicon Valley's tech beasts. Past seasons have covered Amazon and Netflix; now, reporters Shirin Gaffary and Alex Kantrowitz are tackling Google. Why? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shirin:</strong> "The idea with the series was to chronicle the rise of all the major tech giants. And it worked out well because Google is facing these three antitrust lawsuits, and it's also at a crossroads about what it wants its next chapter to be, as it pushes beyond search. We're going to get into the moonshots of Google and what its next big thing is going to be if it evolves beyond being primarily a search company." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Alex:</strong> "I think that Google is subtly the most powerful of all the tech giants. It's the thing that sorts through a huge chunk of online video, with YouTube. It's the browser we use with Chrome. It's the mobile operating system for most of the people who are logging on the internet with smartphones with Android...anywhere you go across the internet, you see Google."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.vox.com/land-of-the-giants-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Listen to episode one</a> and let us know what you think. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether it’s stepping up to the mic on karaoke night or learning how to invest, some things in life you just gotta do with confidence. BREW'S BETS

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sticking the landing: </strong>Tune into <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gm0b_ijaYMQ&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NASA’s YouTube channel</a> at 2:15pm ET to watch the Perseverance rover land on Mars. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No matter how crazy the GameStop saga gets, there’s always a news story or three that's even crazier. Three of these bizarre headlines are real; the other we made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"GM CEO Mary Barra agrees to </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/Wv493An4dA0xi/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debate</a></span><span> battery tech with Elon Musk on Clubhouse"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"World’s longest </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/alberta-hockey-philanthropy-archive-a468e6060c7ec89c7e29eee598720efc?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hockey game</a></span><span> played in deep freeze in Alberta"</span>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIt's GameStarting Again\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/17/gamestop-saga-key-players-set-appear-congressional-committee\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Gavel with GameStop written on it \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemember in January when every other word uttered in English was \"GameStop\"? Get ready for another round at noon today, when the main characters of the saga will have their buns sufficiently warmed by the House Committee on Financial Services. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGameStop was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/25/gamestop-powered-amateur-investors-continues-defy-reality?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ethe \u003c/em\u003estory\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a few weeks ago after a legion of fanatical retail investors mobilized on Reddit to launch a short squeeze that sent GameStop shares rocketing higher and forced hedge funds to seek emergency bailouts. The stock has since succumbed to gravity, trading at around $45 a share, down from $483 at its peak. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, lawmakers will \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/robinhood-reddit-ceos-to-testify-in-congress-on-gamestop-gme-5112714?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eask questions of\u003c/a\u003e the alleged rabble-rousers. Among them, Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev, Reddit CEO Steve Huffman, Citadel CEO Ken Griffin, Melvin Capital founder Gabe Plotkin, and the now-infamous trader Keith “Roaring Kitty” Gill.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat can you expect?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a statement, committee head Rep. Maxine Waters said the hearing will take aim at the hedge fund industry’s “long history of predatory conduct,” as well as unpack Robinhood’s decision to halt trading of GameStop and other meme stocks when interest from individual traders was at its peak. One more phrase to watch on your hearing bingo card: payment for order flow (PFOF). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePFOF\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e involves \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/paymentoforderflow.asp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ererouting trades\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e carried out on one platform to a third party to execute for a small fee. Robinhood makes the majority of its revenue this way, and some critics argue that’s not in the best interest of its customers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven the cult hero Roaring Kitty is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/17/roaring-kitty-keith-gill-defends-gamestop-posts-says-he-is-as-as-bullish-as-ever-on-the-stock.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunder scrutiny\u003c/a\u003e for his social media posts that helped spark retail interest in GameStop. Though the 34-year-old former MassMutual advisor maintains his posts were meant to be educational only, he hasn’t backed away from his commitment to GameStop. “I’m as bullish as I’ve ever been,” he said in a statement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The chances of specific regulations resulting from this far-ranging hearing are slim. But the committee stands ready to peel back the layers of a system they feel is set up to hurt the amateur investor.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For more on the hearing: \u003c/strong\u003eWe wrote \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/18/get-know-gamestop-hearings-five-key-witnesses?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeverything you need to know\u003c/a\u003e about the 5 guys you'll hear from later today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Kathryn Rogers, wife of talk radio personality Rush Limbaugh, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/conservative-radio-personality-rush-limbaugh-has-died-age-70-n1164306?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e on Limbaugh’s radio show that he had died of complications from lung cancer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe didn’t know Limbaugh personally, but we’d guess he preferred his right foot over his left. He rose to prominence during the presidency of Republican Ronald Reagan, whom he adored, and he detested former President Barack Obama, a Democrat. Limbaugh supported former President Trump throughout his presidency, and Trump honored him with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the US’ highest civilian honor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLimbaugh was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/17/business/media/rush-limbaugh-dead.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoften criticized\u003c/a\u003e for making sexist, homophobic, and racist comments, as well as for spreading falsehoods about Obama’s Affordable Care Act and Covid-19. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eLimbaugh pioneered a highly successful genre of lowbrow outrage radio, beginning during the Republican revolution of Reagan’s time in office and lasting through the Trump years. Limbaugh earned $85 million/year and his show was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/rush-limbaugh-right-wing-media-impresario-is-dead-at-70-11613583970?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost-listened-to\u003c/a\u003e US radio talk show in 2020, with more than 20 million monthly listeners. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTexas’s Nightmare Week: What Went Wrong?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTexas’s energy crisis that began last weekend continued to drag through Wednesday. As of last night, 2.7 million homes in the state were still without power in frigid temperatures. Businesses from semiconductor makers to retailers have paused operations. How could something like this \u003ca href=\"https://www.texasmonthly.com/news/what-went-wrong-with-texass-main-electric-grid-and-could-it-have-been-prevented/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehappen\u003c/a\u003e?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe answer is unsatisfying:\u003c/strong\u003e We don’t 100% know yet. Experts need to analyze what exactly went wrong with Texas’s power grid when the storm hit, but we know a few factors contributed to the widespread shutoffs: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe sheer scale of the storm. All 254 of Texas’s counties were under a winter storm warning at the same time. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt takes more energy to keep homes warm when it’s cold than it does to keep them cool when it’s hot—and Texas’s energy system is geared toward A/C.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTexas had not taken \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/02/16/ercot-texas-electric-grid-failure/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewinterization measures\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" to protect its electric grid from freezing weather.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThere’s a lot more competition for limited supplies of natural gas in the winter. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe outages have led to criticism of Texas’s energy grid, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2011/02/08/texplainer-why-does-texas-have-its-own-power-grid/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis (mostly) independent\u003c/a\u003e from the rest of the US. If it were connected to other states, they could conceivably lend Texas their extra power. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut they're not ending up where you might think. US Postal Service data shows that San Fran residents \u003ca href=\"https://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/article/People-are-leaving-S-F-but-not-for-Austin-or-15955527.php?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_content=headlines\u0026utm_campaign=sfc_morningfix\u0026sid=5fda689dea4aed7a287042e1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare indeed leaving\u003c/a\u003e the city in droves—for other Bay Area counties including Alameda, San Mateo, and Marin.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMuch hay has been made of a supposed mass migration away from ultra-expensive San Francisco, where the coronavirus knocked out perks like nightlife, restaurants, and amusement park-like corporate campuses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the new data challenges the idea that business-friendly, high-quality-of-life spots such as Denver and Austin are getting all the ex-San Franciscans. Those two cities were in the top 20 post-SF locations, but waaay behind places just a quick drive from the Embarcadero, like Sonoma County. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e One economist told the SF Chronicle the data could suggest a “silver lining” for the city’s recovery; Past seasons have covered Amazon and Netflix; now, reporters Shirin Gaffary and Alex Kantrowitz are tackling Google. Why? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShirin:\u003c/strong\u003e \"The idea with the series was to chronicle the rise of all the major tech giants. And it worked out well because Google is facing these three antitrust lawsuits, and it's also at a crossroads about what it wants its next chapter to be, as it pushes beyond search. We're going to get into the moonshots of Google and what its next big thing is going to be if it evolves beyond being primarily a search company.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAlex:\u003c/strong\u003e \"I think that Google is subtly the most powerful of all the tech giants. It's the thing that sorts through a huge chunk of online video, with YouTube. It's the browser we use with Chrome. It's the mobile operating system for most of the people who are logging on the internet with smartphones with Android...anywhere you go across the internet, you see Google.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/land-of-the-giants-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\"
